div.p: MS 13071 Royal Society of Victoria Exploration Committee records, box 2076/3, La Trobe Australian Manuscripts Collection, State Library of Victoria, Melbourne.

With reference to the now-forming exploring party,
The expedition of which Robert O'Hara Burke was appointed leader on 30 June 1860, and which became known as the Burke and Wills Exploring Expedition, 1860-1. I am very desirous of accompanying it, and should esteem it a favor if you would advise me as to my course. I can recommend myself as a first-rate zoological artist, & can sketch well, & was when at home familiar with practical botany.

You are probably acquainted with my brother Dr Fox of Kew,
H. T. Fox was a surgeon in Kew, Victoria. & will, I hope pardon my addressing you without further introduction.

div.p:
Alexander Fox
M forwarded Fox's letter to J. Macadam on 27 June 1860. Fox was not appointed by Burke to the Expedition party; see M et al. to the Royal Society of Victoria, December 1860 (in this edition as 60-12-00).
